responseText: NSLOCTEXT("[70199B914E7E03A9706A1499CF20B1FD]", "EA2D77584FE5505AF5B2D291C18BA1A8", "Its face was too angular to be a deer stag, drawn to a point at the snout. And its eyes were wrong, set too low on the sides of its head. It had the hooves of a horse, and its antlers were far thicker than those of a deer, more like the gnarled branches of a maturing tree. Most remarkably, as the creature drank, blue-white sparks of Essence arced between its prongs, crackling with raw energy. It was a creature straight out of the old stories, a legendary mish-mash of deer, horse, giraffe, and ox... a kirin! I stood up slowly, entranced by its otherworldliness and the grace of its movements, drawn forward by an inexplicable urge. I had only taken two steps when an unfortunate footfall snapped a crystalline twig. The kirin raised its head, looked directly at me, and in an instant, dissolved into an ephemeral, shimmering mist that retreated across the water.")
name: DD_Ambient_TotH3_A_35
